New Records: The Dodgers became the first team to come back from five or more runs down in a World Series-clinching win.
Key Match Events: Jack Flaherty allowed back-to-back homers to Aaron Judge and Jazz Chisholm Jr in the first inning, staking a 3-0 lead.
Giancarlo Stanton’s solo shot in the third extended the Yankees' lead to 5-0.
The Dodgers piled on five unearned runs to go level in the fifth behind a series of dreadful errors from the Yankees and RBI hits from Mookie Betts, Freddie Freeman and Teoscar Hernández.
Alex Verdugo’s RBI single in the second chased Flaherty after just four outs.
Teoscar Hernández hit a game-winning RBI single in the eighth inning off Luke Weaver after having loaded the bases with no outs against Tommy Kahnle.
Mookie Betts hit a game-winning RBI single in the eighth inning off Luke Weaver after having loaded the bases with no outs against Tommy Kahnle.
Gavin Lux hit a game-winning RBI single in the eighth inning off Luke Weaver after having loaded the bases with no outs against Tommy Kahnle.
Post-Match Reflections: Shohei Ohtani, the Dodgers' record $700m signing, finished his first World Series with a.105 batting average (2-for-19) with no RBIs after separating his shoulder during a stolen base attempt in Game 2.

Freeman, who homered in the first four games and whose record streak of six straight World Series games with a home run came to an end, hit a two-run single to tie the Fall Classic record of 12 RBIs set by Bobby Richardson over seven games in 1960.
Aaron Boone said after the defeat: 'As I said to the guys, obviously it stings now. But this is going to sting forever.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Jack Flaherty was pulled in the second inning.
The Dodgers deployed no fewer than seven relievers to keep the resurgent Yankee lineup at bay.
The eight pitchers used was a World Series record for a clinching win.
Walker Buehler, making his first relief appearance in more than six years, struck out Verdugo swinging for the final out.
Game 3 winner Walker Buehler earned a win as a starter and recorded the save in the clinching victory after Madison Bumgarner, who did it for the San Francisco Giants in 2014.
Others: The home runs by Judge and Chisholm marked the first back-to-back homers by the Yankees in a World Series since Thurman Munson and Reggie Jackson in Game 5 of the 1978 Fall Classic.
The Dodgers and Yankees were meeting in the World Series for a 12th time, making it the most frequent matchup in the history of the Fall Classic, but it marked their first encounter in 43 years.
